title: Substitution
text: Substitute the $$x-$$ and $$y-$$ values into the equation to check if the ordered pair is a solution to the equation.
speech: Substitute the , x minus  and  y minus  values into the equation to check if the ordered pair is a solution to the equation.
pacedSpeech: values into the equation to check if the ordered pair is a solution to the equation.

title: Application
text: Substitute $$y$$ for $$3$$ and $$x$$ for $$3$$. Are $$3$$ and $$2(3)-3$$ equal? If so, the ordered pair is a solution. If not, the ordered pair is not a solution.
speech: Substitute  y  for  3  and  x  for  3 . Are  3  and  2 times 3 minus 3  equal? If so, the ordered pair is a solution. If not, the ordered pair is not a solution.
pacedSpeech: equal? If so, the ordered pair is a solution. If not, the ordered pair is not a solution.
